segments.text: I notice the woman’s foot already dipped in the puddle, yet she continues to dry that plate as though nothing's amiss.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if she’s living in a bubble, unaware of the water threatening to seep into the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus seems almost admirable, but how can she miss the children’s antics just behind her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy on the stool; he looks determined, yet I can sense the danger looming over him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout and tell him to be careful, to get down before he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him is just waiting, her palm open and ready for that cookie, completely oblivious to the risk involved.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s an innocence to their mischief, but it’s tinged with a recklessness that sends chills down my spine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen feels alive with the rush of water, but all I can do is stand back and watch the impending mishap unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the light catches the dishes makes me appreciate the everyday beauty, but it also makes the chaos feel out of place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but wonder how long it’ll be before someone notices the trouble brewing here.
segments.speaker: PAR
